to make a quip: [ + speech ] When asked why he seemed to be so relaxed, Mr McCarthy quipped: "It's the drugs". "Everyone wants to be Cary Grant. Even I want to be Cary Grant," Grant once quipped.
More examplesFewer examplesHe famously quipped that "con" is short for conservative.Mark Twain once quipped that the game of golf is "a nice walk spoiled".He often quips that his marriage has lasted so long because "we're both in love with the same fellow".
